question: Which institution has estimated that over 150 million people are likely to be in extreme poverty by 2021?
explanation:
The World Bank has warned that as many as 150 million people are likely to be in extreme poverty by 2021, due to the coronavirus pandemic.
The pandemic is expected to push an additional 88 million to 115 million people into extreme poverty this year. As per the biennial Poverty and Shared Prosperity Report, this condition represents a regression to the rate of 9.2 per cent in 2017.
